meanings.definition: A piece of ground in which a house or building stands.
meanings.sent1: The toft behind the house was perfect for a garden.
meanings.sent2: The old farmhouse sat on a toft overlooking the valley.
meanings.sent3: The toft was so small, it could barely fit a shed!
meanings.sent4: Her dreams grew on the toft of her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The toft where the cabin stood was surrounded by tall trees.

meanings.definition: A homestead or site of a house or building.
meanings.sent1: The toft of the ancient castle was now just ruins.
meanings.sent2: The toft of the new mansion was vast and well-kept.
meanings.sent3: The toft seemed to whisper stories of the past to visitors.
meanings.sent4: The toft held the memories of generations within its boundaries.
meanings.sent5: The toft was a place of comfort and history for the family.

meanings.definition: A small piece of land or yard.
meanings.sent1: She sat on the toft outside, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: The toft at the edge of the forest was a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent3: The toft was a tiny oasis in the midst of the city.
meanings.sent4: The toft was a patch of green in the sea of concrete.
meanings.sent5: Children played happily on the toft, their laughter filling the air.
